title: Everything runs locally (zero-external-dependency development)
summary: Build platforms where developers can run all services, data stores, and operational tooling locally using Docker, emulators, and gateway stubs to maximize velocity and minimize environment dependencies.

decisionGuidance.problemSolved: Mainframe and middleware modernization dependencies force developers to connect to remote systems via VPN, wait for environments to be available, and coordinate cross-team integrations early, killing velocity.
whenToUse: Modernizing off mainframe, middleware, or tightly-coupled legacy systems
Multiple domains or services need to interact during development
External dependencies are hard to reach, slow, or unreliable
Team velocity is blocked by environment availability
whenNotToUse: System is simple with few dependencies
External APIs are stable, fast, and well-documented test environments exist

enablingTechnologies: Cloud service emulators (Cosmos, Service Bus, Storage)

gotchas: Upfront investment required to containerize everything
Gateway stubs must return representative responses or tests are misleading
Local resource constraints (memory, disk) for running 7+ services
Keeping local stack in sync with production configuration
Hard to fake certain services (authentication, complex third parties)
thingsToWatchOutFor.opinionatedGuidance: Invest heavily at the start. Containerize all domains, operational tooling (logging, error handling, chaos engineering), and data stores. Build gateway facades for hard-to-reach externals. Defer real integration to the last minute when all systems can line up in a proper environment. This is the only way to maintain velocity during complex modernizations.

complexity.rationale: Requires significant upfront investment to containerize services, build emulators, create gateway stubs, and orchestrate complex Docker Compose setups. Ongoing maintenance as systems evolve.
complexity.skillDemand: Docker expertise, emulator setup, gateway design, local orchestration. Developers must understand container networking and resource limits.
complexity.operationalDemand: High initiallyâ€”must build and maintain local stack. Lower over time as velocity increases.
complexity.toolingDemand: Docker, Docker Compose, cloud emulators, stub frameworks, infrastructure-as-code.

starterDiagram.title: Local development stack
starterDiagram.description: All domains and dependencies run in containers.

realWorldExample.context: Insurance platform modernization with 7 domains and legacy mainframe/middleware dependencies
realWorldExample.approach: Built Docker Compose stack with all domains, Cosmos emulator, Service Bus emulator, Storage emulator, gateway stubs for legacy endpoints. Developer runs 'docker-compose up' and has full platform locally including logging, error handling, and chaos testing.
realWorldExample.outcome: Team velocity increased 3x. Developers iterate independently without VPN or environment coordination. Real integration deferred to final environment testing. Gateway stubs evolved into integration test fixtures.
